intro: Alphonsea tonquinensis var. tonquinensis, commonly known as the Tonkin Alphonsea, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees, and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by orange-red berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
